Reviews.Title: Samsung Quality at a Decent Price
Reviews.Author: NotaSecondTime
Reviews.Content: The 32" version in previous years has been top rated by Consumer Reports. So i purchased the new F model, but not the more expensive 40". A search at the Samsung website for this exact model (UN39FH5000) returns "Sorry, no results were found". Most consumers are being steered to add 1" screen size for $150+ Samsung UN40F5500 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz Slim Smart LED HDTV! Is this 39" model the only bargain in the Samsung line?Just how good is it? I measured a contrast ratio of 10,400:1 which is really excellent!The back-light scanning (labeled LED Clear Motion) blacks the picture while the LCD pixel is changing state. Further no soap opera effect. Since the LEDs are very bright, they still generate enough light with the Clear Motion feature enabled.Once calibrated the display offers a compelling picture quality. I like it!Many of the menu settings are shared between Standard and Movie mode. If they are all set to identical settings, the Movie mode black level is a little darker, just as it should be.Pros:CleanWhite Balance Control (cutoff & gain)Faster HDMI switching timeVery energy efficient - leave it on the whole dayBargain priceVesa wall mountCons:Some sharpness needed for video processing but this degrades computer text. Or stated differently, not as much high frequency detail or refinement as in high end-displays, but fine for 95% of peopleNot ultra-slim or beautiful caseshort power cordI spent several days evaluating and then measuring objectively with a X-Rite EODIS3 i1Display Pro. The latest calibration software lets you adjust the TVs White Balance controls in real-time (i use this for all my PC displays and HDTVs) and luv it! Sure beats paying $400 for a single calibration.Calibration Settings Samsung UN39FH5000Mode: Standard & MovieBacklight 13Contrast 78Brightness 45Sharpness 35Color 509Tint 50/50Dynamic Contrast offBlack Tone offFlesh Tone offColor Space AutoWhite Balance  Cutoff: 20,22,11  Gain: 22,25,9Gamma 0Motion Lighting OffColor Tone Warm1Size Screen Fit (1:1 pixel mapping)Digital Clear offMPEG Filter offLED Clear Motion on (important)

Reviews.Title: Great TV, and also an outstanding value
Reviews.Author: Bunsen Burner
Reviews.Content: I went to the store prepared to buy Samsung's 40-inch LED TV, and found this one on sale for $150 less. I was able to compare the pictures on the two TVs, and to my eyes, the quality was identical. I also couldn't see that the additional 1" was worth that extra money, so I bought the 39-inch model. I couldn't be happier.While in the store, I also had the opportunity to compare the pictures on the Samsung sets with other brands such as LG and Sony. I couldn't see any significant difference between them and the Samsungs. My opinion was confirmed for me when the cable guys came to install my cable - they were blown away by how good the picture was, and these are guys who see a LOT of different TVs.This is not a smart TV, but the Blu-ray player I bought 3 months ago has internet connectivity, and I didn't see the need for a smart TV on top of that. My current setup includes a Sony Blu-ray player, an Xfinity cable box, and this Samsung TV, all connected through a Sony HT-CT150 soundbar with subwoofer. Because the soundbar acts as a hub for all audiovisual functions, setup was extremely simple (plug the Blu-ray into the BD HDMI port on the subwoofer, plug the cable box into the SA/CATV HDMI port on the subwoofer, and plug the subwoofer's TV Out HDMI port into the TV's HDMI 1 port).The picture looked great out of the box, because my viewing room is normally pretty bright, and I haven't had to change any of the default settings. I did play around with them just to see what the differences were, but ended up leaving everything where it started.The audio from the built-in speakers is reasonable, but the soundbar/subwoofer combination make a huge difference.I have nothing but positive things to say about Samsung and this particular TV.Edit: there is one negative thing - the USB port is on the back of the set, which makes it a pain to connect or disconnect. More thoughtful design would have put it where access was simple - on the front or on the side. That's not a factor for me at this time, because I use the USB port on my Blu-ray player if I want to go that route.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Gaming TV
Reviews.Author: Cherrio
Reviews.Content: I started researching TVs as I was looking for something for the bedroom and gaming. I considered the positives and negatives between LED and Plasma, size vs. price, name brand vs. off-brand sets, and 60 vs. 120Hz. Finally, I settled on the Samsung UN39FH5000 for a few reasons. These were the screen size, number of positive reviews, and the price point. I am not disappointed with my purchase.I knew right off that I didn't want to go below 40 inches. I have previously used a 32 inch TV for gaming and it felt too small. I like that this TV is cheaper than the 40 inch Samsung, and at 39" it is close enough to fit my needs. I have the TV set-up in a bedroom and it fills the space nicely. It is large enough for everything I do with it, and while sitting just 6-10 feet away, it doesn't feel overly big. For the size, the TV is light weight and can easily be picked up and moved by 1 person. Due to its overall size, attaching the stand might be annoying for you. I did it on my own and had to bend oddly to tighten the screws. Once attached the TV feels sturdy, despite its light weight.One complaint I read a lot about for this TV was its poor sound. When asked for specifics, no one elaborated appropriately. So if you have these same concerns then rest assured that the sound is great. The TV is very loud, in my bedroom I keep it around 12-15 for gaming (out of a possible 100), and around 8 while watching TV during the day. At night I sometimes lower the volume to 4 or 6 and I am still able to hear it perfectly. I have no complaints about the levels of volume or my ability to clearly hear the sound coming from the built in speakers. The TV has various sound options (Standard, Music, Movie, Clear Voice, and Amplify). I keep it set on Standard and it works great for both gaming and watching TV. With that said, the built in speakers are not going to give you a surround sound-like experience while gaming or watching movies. I think we all knew that already, which made me very confused why I saw some reviews point this out. It seems commonsense that you are only going to get as good as the TV can give. Expecting something better and then complaining about it, has no place in a logical discussion, let alone a review.A previous review claims to have utilized expensive calibration equipment to pick the best settings for this TV. I have an extremely accurate color definition and am able to pick up subtle shades between colors. To my eyes, the settings found in that review left the screen dull, washed out, and void of the correct color tones. The settings I am currently using (for gaming and regular TV) are the following:Mode: StandardBacklight: 14Contrast: 60Brightness: 55Sharpness: 45Color: 55Tint: 50/50Dynamic Contrast: LowBlack Tone: DarkFlesh Tone: 0Color Space: AutoWhite Balance: 22, 23, 25, 25, 25, 23Gamma: 0Motion Lighting: OffColor Tone: StandardSize: Screen FitDigital Clean View: OffMPEG Noise Filter: AutoHDMI Black Level: LowLED Clear Motion: OffI am not an expert. I do not own any calibration equipment. These are just the settings I have settled with for gaming and cable. My systems are connected via HDMI and these settings currently seem the best for me. So try them, perhaps as a baseline and then make adjustments to fit your needs. Be sure to read the manual as it has descriptions for most of the settings.This TV only has 2 HDMI inputs, and I wish it had more. I like to keep a variety of things connected and only having 2 is really limiting. This may be something to consider if you are just starting to research TV sets. Another small complaint is that the stand does not swivel. This means you better have enough shelf/table space to rotate the TV to fit your needs. Wall mounting is always an option, for those that need it.This is a no frills, basic TV, with basic options. It will get you watching TV, gaming, and enjoying movies for around $100 less than the nearest competitor. This may not be the TV you want for the center of your expensive entertainment system, but for a bedroom and some modern gaming, it works great!

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Mountain Man "Rough Rider"
Reviews.Content: This is one great TV for the price!  Picture is fantastic, and setup was really easy.  Right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Good but not great
Reviews.Author: Noot
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a secondary set for the house and it is good in that role.  It took some time but I was finally able to make the picture look acceptable.  When I first put content to it at factory settings the picture was awful.  Everything was cast in a blue haze.  My guess is this is due to a bluish LED backlight.  Huge thanks to the review with the calibration settings.  You can see that he(?) turns the blue way down (in white levels) in addition to warming up the color temp of the display.  I ended up tweaking a bit under the specified levels for blue and a good chunk under green as well.  No calibration disk (yet), just pull up a known cartoon with lots of primary colors and play with those white levels.  I used Mickey Mouse Club House.Its still not perfect.  The blue haze is gone but a very slight yellow tone has replaced it.  Next project will be AVS HD 709 calibration.  Hopefully I can get it dialed in.  I gave it three stars for the trouble.  My Panasonic plasma (primary set) was practically calibrated out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 39 inch
Reviews.Author: SS S.
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my den great picture using chrome cast  to view netflix movies.  Would recommend this tv under 400$ and free shipping no tax

Reviews.Title: Perfect size for me
Reviews.Author: Socks Fan
Reviews.Content: Finally got too frustrated with my small screen TV during the World Series and ordered this. My daughter and son-in-law had bought a similar model about a year earlier, so I'd had a chance to try it before buying. I'm really happy with the size and crispness of the picture.

Reviews.Title: Great for digital media
Reviews.Author: JoshM5683
Reviews.Content: I have a 60" Samsung D series that at the time was top of the line.  I chose that model because I could hook a harddrive directly into it and play media, even 3D media and it was flawless.  I wanted a tv for my bedroom and this was a nice option that popped up on slickdeals for 358 shipped so I got it.  I bought a WD Media player thinking I would need one to play all the different file types on my drives.  When the TV came I hooked up the TV and probably 90% of them worked just fine.The picture on this one is fine, I can't notice a ton of difference between this and my D series.  I know its only 60hz versus 240 but everything is filmed for the most part at 24fps and at most 48, so a 60hz refresh isn't a big deal on a non 3D file.  If I had to pick a downside I guess I wish it had more USB ports but thats pretty nitpicky.  The remote feels pretty cheap, but all Samsung remotes I've seen aren't great.  Overall the value of this tv is great and I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: All around nice TV, good for gaming
Reviews.Author: Joshua T
Reviews.Content: The design is great, great features and picture. I use the TV for gaming and it has no input lag which is awesome. The sound is good i'm not critical about the sound where a sound bar would be needed but thats just me.

Reviews.Title: This TV Does Its Job!
Reviews.Author: R. Portis "Tredogg14TK"
Reviews.Content: This TV does its job. I am not going to get into my settings and too much detail but I will give a little bit of background as to why I bought this TV instead of another.I upgraded from a Sony Bravia 32" KDL325000 which succumbed to power surge. I wanted to buy the Sony 40" KDL-40R450A, but this Samsung just seemed better. The Sony 40" LED is similar to this Samsung model in almost everyway. The only thing that separated the two was the Samsung was cheaper and the base was taller. The Sony 40" LED I was viewing was very squat and did not have a neck like this model. Since my TV is sitting on an entertainment center, I did not want something that was low and squat.Overall: You can't go wrong with a Samsung. This TV is definitely 100x better than my old LCD. There is not a thing I do not like about this TV. I play my PS3 on it and watch HD TV. This TV does what you want it to do.5/5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great out of the box!
Reviews.Author: Mark Dale
Reviews.Content: I looked at reviews for over a month and decided on this tv instead of the LG similar size version. We had a great LG but after it was replaced with the same model after a lightning strike it was just not the same. The LG had a a very bad sound, very tinny so I opted on the Samsung. I don't know if it is where I have it placed or if the sound is way much better but it sounds great! So much so that I had to buy a sound bar for the other TV since I felt guilty about mine. Picture is very good out of the box but some fine tuning is needed as with all of them. I disliked the sound it made when it was turned off and on but after a day or two of playing with the remote I found how to turn it off. Manual is very cheesy so just keep playing with buttons and you will find out what they all do. Great tv for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, easy set up
Reviews.Author: M Shah
Reviews.Content: Extremely pleased with this purchase.  The picture quality is great and it was very easy to set up.  The sound isn't great, but most tv's aren't.  We will have to pair it with some speakers if we want better sound.  For the money, very pleased in spite of that.

Reviews.Title: I'm happy with it
Reviews.Author: Anne Lyons
Reviews.Content: This is my first flat-screen television. I've had it for about three months now. It took me just as many months to research TVs before I settled on this one. My research was a mix of poring over internet reviews and observing TVs in stores like Best Buy. I decided to go with this one because I liked the picture quality and it was about the size (slightly smaller, but it works in my living room) that I was looking for. I bought it directly from a Best Buy store.So far, I'm pleased with it. When I first plugged it in, I experienced what some other reviewers said about the picture not looking like anything they saw in the store. I finally realized that I didn't have the input set to HDMI. After I did that, I didn't really have to do too much adjusting of the picture settings. I've also learned that part of the quality of the picture is due to your cable/satellite service. I use Verizon Fios, and some channels come in great, and others, sometimes the color is slightly off or it's just not as sharp.Sound-wise, I think it's actually not as bad as mentioned in some of the reviews I found. I was expecting really poor sound based on what I had been reading and was thinking that I would have to buy a separate sound bar. But the sound is decent when I use Fios. However, when I plug my laptop in to play Netflix movies, I noticed then that there are issues with the sound, where I have to keep adjusting the volume because suddenly the background music or sound effects are very loud and are overpowering the dialog.I decided against getting the Smart TV. I've been researching the Roku 3 and some blue ray players, but in the meantime, I've just been hooking up my laptop via an HDMI cable, and that gets the job done for me. The picture is great; the sound is decent, barring what I described above. I have an old Roku player that I could use via the A/V inputs in the back of the television, but I haven't tried it yet, so I can't speak to that picture or sound quality.Picture-wise, it's semi-glossy, but actually does pretty well in my apartment, which is very well-lit by uncurtained windows during the day. At night, I can see the reflections of my living room lamps in it, but it's not distracting like it was with my old box TV.  The only weird think about it is that there's almost like this darkness to the picture. I'm not sure how to describe what I mean. It doesn't affect the color or hide anything in the picture. But it is different than watching something on a box television set.All of the inputs are in the back of the television. I use the stand, which is very sturdy. You have to screw the stand to the set. The screws are included and it was really hard to get them in, but I think it was because I didn't have the correct screwdriver.

Reviews.Title: Best low end LED.
Reviews.Author: IBrown
Reviews.Content: First, if you've seen the F5500 models in stores with the terrible LCD panel with giant dark pixels, this model has a better one (as do all the other models, starting with the F6030). This is Samsung's lowest end 2013 LED, so it is on par with mid range from cheaper brands. Picture quality is good and motion blur is very low for a cheap LED. The picture options are extensive and the audio is better than most brands.I attached a Roku and put it in the bedroom. Picture, sound, and reliability of one of best quality brands are worth the extra cost over cheaper brands. You may want to spring for the F6300 If you can get a price close to the FH5000 + Roku. The F5500's LCD panel is made by someone else and I thought its pixels were to visible, but it is a Smart TV and cheaper than the F6300.

Reviews.Title: Problem with base assembly
Reviews.Author: SCLsurfer
Reviews.Content: Don't know if it's a manufacturing issue or if I got one that was returned and resold but the screen was leaning forward when it was assembled. 2 screw holes on the back of the base we're either drilled/molded incorrectly or completely stripped as the supplied screws spun in the screwholes (note: all the screws supplied are same size supplied so wasn't a size/hole mismatch). Took the base apart carefully and reassembled to see if was an alignment issue but didn't resolve the leaning screen. I have 2 other (more expensive flat-screens - Sony and Samsung) with well designed base/TV interfaces but the base design on this one is overly-complicated - assume to cut costs. Returned it to Amazon and bought the same model from Costco (in case I had to return it for same base issue but the new one assembled fine). Overall, it's a solid TV (at this v economical price point) with a very good/excellent picture - aside from the base assembly issue I experienced. We've had good experiences with other Samsung products which is one of the reasons we bought it so hoping this was an quality-control aberration.

Reviews.Title: Decent purchase
Reviews.Author: Samsung buyer
Reviews.Content: Hello,I am happy with this TV so far. For those of you who are not very satisfied with the sound, try setting the Auto Volume feature to on. You may also want to tweak the equalizers that are available in the standard mode. The picture is great with good back levels. Also, it is a backlit led and not an edge lit (I found this info in an online article and also verified the same by calling samsung). The only downside is that the corners have slightly dim patches when viewing plain backgrounds, but I have seen this in almost all the big screen tvs and I was told at the store that calibrating the picture would fix that.Thank you and hope the above review is useful to someone.

Reviews.Title: This is by far the best deal you will find on a TV in this price range
Reviews.Author: Thomas M
Reviews.Content: The black level on this panel is just stunning. Deep blacks and great contrast. Re watching my blurays was a real treat. Blu rays I thought weren't so great now really shine.This is direct LED backlighting Display not edge lit. It make a big difference. A true IPS display(this is still debated but I tend to agree as the colors are perfect) for using as a PC monitor and colors are perfect.There is a top review on the page that I stole the settings for and I'll re post them hereThese aren't mine but they are a great starting point for TV and movies. It comes bright out of the box and doesn't look great. It looks good out of the box but not great. With a bit of tweaking you can make this look amazing.For TV and Movies(blu-ray,DVD)Calibration Settings Samsung UN39FH5000Mode: Standard & MovieBacklight 13Contrast 78Brightness 45Sharpness 35Color 50Tint 50/50Dynamic Contrast offBlack Tone offFlesh Tone offColor Space AutoWhite Balance Cutoff: R-20,G-22,B-11 Gain: R-22,G-25,B-9Gamma 0Motion Lighting OffColor Tone Warm1Size Screen Fit (1:1 pixel mapping)Digital Clear offMPEG Filter offLED Clear Motion on (important)What you should do is set each source to the proper type. For my blu-ray player I have it set to Blu-ray, for PC I set it to PCMake SURE if you are using this as a PC monitor to SET THE SOURCE NAME TO PC or PC DVI. It makes a huge difference. Also use HDMI port 2 for PCTo change the source type (DVD, Satellite STB, CABLE STB, AV RECEIVER, GAME, GAME CONSOLE, PC DVI PC...and I left out a bunch) PRESS THE SOURCE BUTTON then highlight the source you wish to change. Now PRESS THE TOOLS BUTTON and select edit name.It helps with the calibration and helps you remember what is what.People are annoyed that is makes a sound when you turn it on. It does but you can set it to low or turn the sound off.The speakers sound great. I have this going through a 5.1 receiver BUT I usually just use the speakers when watching TV.It only has two HDMI ports which is disappointing but at this prices and this quality I don't mind.I THOUGHT I GOT A STEAL OF A PRICE @ $380.00 from Walmart about 45 days ago because it beat Amazon's price and ease of returning the product. The price from Amazon right now has dropped to $350 and there's no reason to look at any other TV unless you want smart features.It comes bright out of the box and doesn't look great. Try those setting as see if it changes for you. Work form there.It's only 60hz but is sometimes advertised as 120 hz due to technology built in that increases the rate. Does it? I think so. Watching sports I can tell a difference. It also smooths out the screen so It look really good with that setting on.I can find a few faults with this TV if I really try but I can't imagine any TV under $400 having any of these1. No independent PC input. Only two HDMI ports which is limiting.2  It has a optical out(toslink) which only passes PCM 2.0 stereo from your devices. So if you plug your blur ray and your cable box in with HDMI and use a optical cable to connect the TV to receiver IT WILL NOT BE 5.1Over the air and anything internal would be but since it's not a smart TV that basically means only over the air TVMost Receivers have multiple HMDI inputs and one output. So this way you really only need one HDMI port for all your devices and the audio is played right through the receivers sound system.4. It doesn't have an HDMI return channel.That's it. It's a steal at this price and when you register on Samsung they give you an extra 3 months of warranty for a total of 15 months in home service. I extended mine with Square Trade. If you pay more than $30 you are getting a bad price. Look for coupon codes or buy on Square trade on Amazon when you buy the product and it's usually a reduced price. You have 30 days to cancel Square Trade for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Great tv!
Reviews.Author: Alexander Duncan
Reviews.Content: The picture is great, the colors are rich, the blacks are very black, and this screen is quite bright.  I think this TV is a great bang for the buck.  I don't mind that it isn't a smart TV as I am using it as a monitor and TV anyway, so I get all the features that a smart TV would get anyway.

Reviews.Title: No Audio Out
Reviews.Author: Blue Bass
Reviews.Content: Compared to my old CRT television this set has a great picture. The on board speakers are fine for typical programming but I thought about adding modern external speakers and found no audio output. I should have looked more carefully before buying.

Reviews.Title: NIce But Flawed
Reviews.Author: Occasional Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I bought this Samsung 39" TV (not from Amazon) for a bedroom and had to return the first one because of a loud buzzing noise coming from the LED backlight. The noise was obviously not from the audio since it was present even on mute and the tone could be changed (also the loudness increased  or reduced) by adjusting the backlight. There was also a strong odor of plastic as if some component was overheating. In a quiet bedroom the noise was too annoying to tolerate with the TV muted, and was noticeably present at low volume.  I exchanged the first TV for another of the same model, and while it is significantly quieter and doesn't smell as strongly, the same noise is still present. The noise has gotten slightly louder over the last few weeks, but since the return period is up and we like the TV otherwise, we'll keep it and hope that it doesn't get much louder.  Other than the annoying sound, we like most things about the TV; The picture is very good, although not quite as good as our 40" Sony. It is brighter though, and can be otherwise adjusted to taste. The remote is one of the better ones I've used, fairly logically laid out and comfortable to hold. While I don't particularly like shiny black plastic, the stand and bezel are pretty unobtrusive. The sound is serviceable - I found the standard setting with the surround sound turned on is clear and pleasant. The menu system is about average, irritating in some areas and intuitive in others. I'm annoyed that there is no dedicated favorite channel button on the remote, and the channel list button cannot be set to default to the favorites. It would be nice if manufacturers spent more time thinking through menus and remotes, and maybe actually used them for a while. The HDMI and USB connections all point straight out near the middle of the back, good for bunching the cables together, but for wall hanging cables or adapters with 90 degree ends may be required.  If not for the noisy backlight, I'd give the TV a solid 4 stars and feel that it was a very good value in a lower end set. However, the noise is unacceptable at any price level and seems to me to be a quality control failure and probably part of the general race to the bottom in terms of using low end components.  I'd recommend that anyone who is sensitive to sound not buy this set for use in a quiet room. The noise in the second one we bought would probably not be an issue in an area of average background sound, but I can't see any good reason a TV should make any sound at all when on mute. Our other LED TVs and computer monitors are silent, or nearly so.

Reviews.Title: The Best Ever
Reviews.Author: HAYDER
Reviews.Content: Samsung TVs still have the best everything compared with the other TVs. In addition, It's preferred not only in the US, but even around the world

Reviews.Title: Great TV for its Size
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Putting this in perspective, I own 6 TV ranging from Cathode Rays to an 80 inch Sharp Quartro. For its size, this is a very nice picture. Easily pairs with my Samsung Bluray Player, and does its job as a TV in the exercise room. This is a great buy for a small room, or as use for a computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: samsung products always top quality and reliable
Reviews.Author: jerome ogden
Reviews.Content: samsung products always top quality and reliable. Have tvs, refrigerators and computers, all Samung, all high-quality and never needing to fall back on warranty.

Reviews.Title: Samsung quality, Amazon Easy
Reviews.Author: Garry Fredrickson
Reviews.Content: As advertised, Samsung has a beautiful picture and clarity. Easy setup, easy order, quick delivery.From start to finish, I could not be happier with a purchase.

Reviews.Title: Consider Other Settings
Reviews.Author: IMB
Reviews.Content: I connected this TV to standard DirecTV satellite box using just the red and white and yellow cables ( AV) connection.I also used the Dynamic Mode and the settings given in other review as a guide. Dynamic Mode made a big difference. Picture is bright with good contrast and color. I also used Zoom 1. Excellent picture and sound. Good Tv for price. The settings vary to your taste. Try to experiment a bit changing settings. Can make a big difference.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for Gaming on xbox one
Reviews.Author: shawn
Reviews.Content: Very little lag for gaming, plenty of ports, headphone/ audio out, plenty of features and settings to play with. Speakers are very impressive and it's set up on a sturdy stand. Slim bezel adds a sleek and beautiful design. Samsung knows how to make good products. Very impressed.

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV for the money
Reviews.Author: cadguy49
Reviews.Content: This is a nice TV for the money.  I'm sure that video purists would find it subpar (some minimal pixilation), but a video purist would probably not buy this TV.  It has a bright picture and the color is excellent.  I bought it for my 82 year old mother (who is a sports nut) and she loves it.  Also I find the sound to be above par.

Reviews.Title: perfect for the price
Reviews.Author: Jason K.
Reviews.Content: Needed a smaller TV for the family room in a condo that is not lived in full time, have had good luck with Samsung TV's in the past and for the price, this was hard to beat.The 60Hz refresh rate is noticeable but I am comparing that to a 60" Samsung Plasma that has a refresh rate of 600Hz.  I think people develop a bit of a preference for one of the other and while they may not last as long, and screen burn in can be an issue, I prefer the look of a plasma.I would compare he picture on this LED to that of a decent, mid-range computer monitor.  Blu-Ray does look very good and cable is acceptable.  Samsung design is simple and the stand is pretty basic.  I do appreciate the smaller bezels when compared to some older LCD or other brands.

Reviews.Title: Looks good and sound good
Reviews.Author: Illini Fan
Reviews.Content: We got this to replace a TV in our bedroom. The old TV was much smaller and had poor picture quality. This one just fit in our cabinet. The bezel is not small, but not overly big either. The picture quality is outstanding. We currently only watch SD programs on it, but the upscaler does a wonderful job of converting it to digital.

Reviews.Title: Looks great
Reviews.Author: H. Figge "HF"
Reviews.Content: A nice, sleek looking unit, with a good picture and good sound.  Only disappointment was with the stand. The advert we saw quoted a swivel (left-right) stand, but it is rigid.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This isn't the world's greatest TV, but for the money, it's hard to beat. To me the picture looks really good and the sound is suprisingly good. The only drawbacks are the limited number of HDMI ports and the lack of a headphone jack. (I've gotten around these limitations by using third-party devices.)

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Faithy "MASS"
Reviews.Content: this tv literally took less than hour to put stand together, add cable program, program tv remote to cable remote, picture and sound perfect- didn't have to touch a thing.

Reviews.Title: Switched from analog
Reviews.Author: Irene
Reviews.Content: I finally stepped into the 21st century and it only took me a decade and a half. I bought this to replace an old work horse of a 20 year old analog magnavox in my living room. I didn't need to join in the digital switchover years ago since I was hooked up to cable but I finally decided to take the plunge and get rid of the 300 pound magnavox before it outlived me.I didn't need a huge screen because we sit about 9 or 10 feet from the tv. This is the perfect size so I couldn't see spending extra to get a 40 inch when 39 looks good to me. I didn't need a smart tv because my husband is a gamer and we have internet through the xbox so again this was perfect.  Let me say first off the picture is gorgeous. It was easy to set up right out of the box even for someone like me who has never had a digital tv or seen these types of connections before. The on screen menu made it easy and it basically set itself up. When it was done I connected both the xbox 360 and the wii to it with no problems. That was good because the owners manual leaves a lot to be desired and the sections written in English are not grammatically correct. When streaming netflix in HD the picture is incredible. The sound could be a little richer and fuller in my opinion but as far as getting my money's worth I am pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Samsung makes great TV's that are best in their class, but be aware this is not a Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Christopher J. Cowen
Reviews.Content: Samsung makes great TV's that surpass every other manufacturer in their class. I have this TV as well as another Samsung in my house and I can tell you the image is beautiful. The only drawback with this TV it's not a smart TV and you would need to use a WiFi router like Google TV or Roku to get it to connect to the internet. This is why I gave this TV 4 stars instead of 5. But if this is not an issue than this TV would be a smart purchase.One thing that I have found with TV's that its very important to actually look at the TV in person. Now when you look at the TV's, go to a place like Walmart to see them, because many times specialty stores like Best Buy play with the lighting controls on the TV and in the store to skew the image to there advantage. Once you look at the TV simply look and decide which one looks better to you.The next step when looking for TV's is what features come with it. I have listed a few for you here:- This Samsung comes with a technology called Clear Motion Rate (CMR). CMR can depict fast-moving images with sharp detail and vivid contrast while eliminating image distortion.- This TV also comes with Wide Color Enhancer Plus (WCEP). WCEP allows you to witness the entire RGB spectrum on your screen to bring.- The final feature that I thought was a good add-on that comes with this TV is ConnectShare. ConnectShare lets you watch videos, play music, or view photos from a USB connection without needing to use a PC or special equipment. Simply plug your USB device or drive directly into your Samsung TV's USB port and watch on the big screen with friends and family (Here is how you could get around user wireless router for this TV). You can put movies or other content onto a thumbdrive you push it on to the TV directly.Thank you for reading my review, if you have any questions feel free to email me, I would be happy to help you with any questions you have.

Reviews.Title: I like the picture, but the audio .....
Reviews.Author: H. Kaplan
Reviews.Content: .... is very poor.  I will be returning it.  On talking voice material it is fine, but music like piano pieces with sustained lower to middle range notes cause and horrible buzzing even at low volumes.  The speakers are buzzing and the flimsy plastic back panel also buzzes!  This TV is in a bedroom and I do not want to invest in a sound bar or external audio devices.  I am not expecting home theater type sound, but just clean sound with no buzzing.Update - Gave Samsung a chance to fix the sound issue. First support person told me to buy a sound bar!  I asked for his supervisor and got him to agree to send out someone to look at the issue.  Service tech told me he has seen sound issues many times with these slim designs and assured me he could fix it with a swap of the speakers (not really needed - he said this) as well as some felt strips on the cabinet.  Well it did NOTHING.  Same buzzing.Watching him I could immediately see what was doing all the buzzing.  It is the large metal back over the display module.  Tapping it with my finger produced the sound I am hearing from the TV.  The speakers are attached directly to the back of the this metal cover.  What is needed are some foam dampers on the LCD back. As an Electronic Engineer that works in the sound industry (Fender guitar amps) I suggested he try and install some thick foam between the plastic flimsy back and the metal LCD back, but he did not want to do this as his allotted service time was used up.  The fix would be so simple.  Amazing to me that Samsung lets this design get out in the field.  I guess they figure most will use the set with an external sound system.  I feel the device should give reasonable sound without external systems.I could fix it myself, but it bugs me to spend money on a product that has issues.  I will take it back and hopefully find another model that has decent sound without external sound bars or audio systems.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous TV
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: Great TV--------works  great and good quality.-----was priced right too!  I am very satisfied with my purchase. This is my second Samsung TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture!
Reviews.Author: Jan E. Soltys
Reviews.Content: I have a Roku so a smart television is redundant.  This model works great.  Beautiful picture and easy set-up. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied!!
Reviews.Author: Chrystal2727
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv- picture is very clear and was easy to mount. You can't go wrong with a samsung!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Fit and Perfect Picture
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My original TV arrived damaged. I wasn't home and the carrier left it outside for me. I don't know if carrier laid it in the wrong place or the wind did it. Either way they and Amazon stood behind the product and had a new one ready for shipping within 24 hours. Note to all TV buyers. Plug in new TVs BEFORE you mount them to your stand and / or wall mount only to find out the TV has damage to the LCD that you can't see. Been there and done that. picture is fantastic. The menus are easy to navigate and I love the internally lit remote. The only complaint (and it is minor) is that the audio hookups are limited to digital only. This was identified on the specifications and is a result of the manufacturers saving space by minimizing the amount of Printed Circuit Boards that are added to the TV set. Fewer boards equals shallower TV. The sound from the TV just isn't full enough for me. I like bass in my movies so the explosions pop! I've been wanting to upgrade my sound system for some time now. I'll either upgrade the receiver or I'll buy an adapter.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Lousy Sound
Reviews.Author: Warren Holzem
Reviews.Content: My 7 year old 37" LCD was nearing the end of its life, and the new network season was starting. Yeah, that's right. I still mostly watch the primetime shows on the broadcast networks, and I'll admit it.I don't play video games. I don't watch epic movies, expecting to be enveloped into a new reality with a tiny screen. I don't watch football games, expecting to be transported onto the field. I mostly watch sitcoms, and an occasional "reality" show or scripted drama. And I'm normally doing other things, like writing this review, at the same time.I want a TV that won't need to be replaced in two years, but I don't want to spend a fortune, either. My research, including talking to a TV repair person, said that while no one can predict the future, there are a lot of brands on the list that I was told to avoid. Samsung was on the short list of reliable brands.So wanting a TV in the upper 30-inches or lower 40-inches, I was drawn to this model by its price point, and other reviews.From straight on, the picture is really great. I really love it. From a really sharp angle, it is more washed-out than I expected, but I'm also talking about an angle that I'd never really watch from, but rather just what I see as I'm coming into the room.I thought set-up was easy. Scanning the cable took longer than I expected, and while the second step of eliminating scrambled channels took nearly as long, I had to do that manually with my old set. I also appreciate that you can set the channel-up/channel-down buttons to just go up and down on those channels you mark as favorites.The biggest downfall of this set is the sound is crappy. I don't have a home theater system in this room. My old set sounded like a good bookshelf system. I would compare this TV's sound to that of a cheap clock-radio. I don't need a lot, but I'm very seriously considering a sound bar because the sound on this set is so bad.I'm giving this set 4-stars based just on the sound. That's how bad the sound is. If you have a home theater system, or already have a sound bar, consider this to be a 5-star set.

Reviews.Title: Expected Better from Samsung
Reviews.Author: C. Tranel
Reviews.Content: Out of the box, picture quality was poor.  Even after major adjustments, the picture was worse than my 10 year old Toshiba DLP.  Sound was fine for our use (tv shows, no movies).  It is unlikely that we will consider Samsung when it comes time to replace our living room set.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality
Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV over at Best Buy because it was on sale and we needed a new TV.  The image quality when we brought it home was washed out.  No matter how we tried to set the saturation, contrast, etc. in the menu,  we couldn't improve upon it much at all.  Two weeks into using the TV,  a white spot appeared on the lower-right corner of the screen.  We took it to Best Buy but it's too late for an exchange.  We will have to wait to get it repaired and we're stuck with it.  It seems that Samsung LEDs are known for this issue, from what I am now seeing on Google.  You're better off with an LCD.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: D. Miller "Jazz Fan"
Reviews.Content: Bought this 39 inch set based on the reviews and I was not disappointed.  The picture is just awesome.  I used the calibration setting that one of the other reviewers posted in their review below. Those setting are much better than the default or "out of the box" setting.I purchased this set for the bedroom so I didn't want or need a smart TV, just a basic set with a great picture, well this is the one.  I also purchased Samsung BD-F5100 Blu-ray Disc Player which has all the internet connection features that the TV does not. For the price, this is a bargain for a Samsung.  $375 for the set and 60 bucks for the Blu-ray.  Get this one while you can.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!  Awesome Picture!
Reviews.Author: Edward W. Storin
Reviews.Content: Wasn't totally sure I wanted this, but now that I have it I love it.  Hung this in my bedroom but I have another Samsung that I love in my living room.  I'm totally a fan of the brand at this point.  There were no issues with the sound which I had read was questionable.  In fact, the sound is great.

Reviews.Title: Leans backwards?
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I set up this TV last night and it leans slightly backwards at about 5 degrees when attached to the stand that came with it. I'm not sure why it does this and it's very annoying! The Samsung customer service people said that is normal for all 5000 series TVs. I've reassembled it a few times now with no change.Has anyone else had this problem??

Reviews.Title: So, so product.
Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: Easy set up.  Great picture. Sound quality is not very good.  Several features on the remote stopped working almost immediately after I used them, this is frustrating.

Reviews.Title: A decent set for the money
Reviews.Author: Joseph M Galloy
Reviews.Content: This set replaces a 6-year old JVC LT-37x688 which bit the dust (bad mainboard). The JVC had an excellent picture, and the DirecTV installer (and other people since) commented on the fabulous picture. The TV repairman said it wouldn't be worth repairing the JVC because a new 39" could be had for around the same price, and I thought that with several years of new technology, any new 1080p set should look at least as good as my old one, so after weeks of reading reviews I grabbed this set from another retailer. I got it for a great price. But when I got it home, I was quite disappointed in the picture. Everything looks flat, the picture isn't sharp, and natural light coming through windows (in the film or show, not my windows) dramatically washes out the entire scene. I tried calibrating according to the instructions of another reviewer, and it improved the picture substantially, but it's still nowhere near as nice as my old JVC. The JVC's speakers were also a bit better, but the Samsung's are acceptable.Update after owning a few months: Since posting my original review, I've calibrated the set using the following free tool, which includes test patterns and a manual:[...]I was immediately much happier with the resulting picture. I still think that the JVC had a better picture overall, but I'm now used to and comfortable with my purchase of the Samsung set. I think it provides a decent picture for the money. The only thing that I wish it had was a better over-the-air tuner. My other set had no problems on any channels with the same amplified indoor antenna, but the Samsung has persistent trouble tuning in our relatively weak PBS signal. A new antenna purchase likely coming in the near future!

Reviews.Title: It's a tv
Reviews.Author: db the 9er
Reviews.Content: This is the best tv I have ever had. I love the picture. It responds to the remote very quickly and I like that.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Set
Reviews.Author: Norman Demby
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture and easy to set up.  My hard to please wife loves it so that is the best recommendation I can think of.

Reviews.Title: great value for price
Reviews.Author: Joel B.Lee,Sr.
Reviews.Content: item was shipped & arrived 3 d sooner than promised. item arrived in perfect plug & play condition.this product enhances my already high opinion of samsung products.it replaced a 2006 30 inch hdtv toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Keeping It Simple
Reviews.Author: S_Hughes
Reviews.Content: This is the second flat screen Samsung TV that I have purchased...One for me several years ago and this one for a family member.  Picture quality is great and the unit is lightweight.  The set up was simple in that the TV is only being used with a cable box and Roku unit.  After installing the included base, we plugged in the power and two HDMI cords and we were up and running in minutes.  Note that the included base is not adjustable for viewing angle and there are only two HDMI ports.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Hiral S Vikmani
Reviews.Content: got the TV for $300! this is a steal for 39inch TV.Pros: Great TV, simple assembly, 2 HDMI input and a USB inputCons: Not a smart TV. But its still a great price for this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Poppies_rule
Reviews.Content: Got this TV for my screened in porch.  Wanted something light to make mounting easier and fairly inexpensive since even though covered it will be outside and may not last forever.  It's a pretty nice TV.  It has no smart features but a Roku stick fixed that easy enough and was a cheaper, easier, better option than buying a TV with Smart features.  The picture is decent, about what you'd expect for the price.  I like the small bezel so there isn't a lot of wasted space.

Reviews.Title: Nice Picture
Reviews.Author: shep
Reviews.Content: This 39" replaced my HP 37" LCD HDTV 1080i. The picture quality of this 39" 1080P is more sharp and clear than my HP.Both TV's I used Dynamic setting, Backlight 18, Contrast 85, Brightness 50, Sharpness 80, Color 65, Tint 50/50.Be aware with TV's 40" or less the difference between 1080i & 1080P is probably not as noticeable as shop salesmen would say.I do notice a quality picture difference in this Samsung TV having settings identical in both TV's. Directv is the source when not playing DVD's.  Sound is excellent using my Sony Theater sound system. I am pleased with the overall quality which prompted me to buy a Samsung Blu-Ray.

Reviews.Title: Received in good order.
Reviews.Author: Stuartbh
Reviews.Content: Received in good order.  Works well.  Does not include any cables.  The only instructions were for mounting the base.Does not include operating instructions!

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: VinsanityAL
Reviews.Content: Nice TV. Was easy to setup and works well with other Samsung Products (Samsung Blu Ray Player) Will definitely consider buying another one

Reviews.Title: Man vs Woman
Reviews.Author: Born2shop
Reviews.Content: My husband wanted a 50" smart tv.  I'm happy with this 39".  Its got a good picture and its clear in any area of the room.  I want to feel like I'm at home, not in a theater.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: RCAJ
Reviews.Content: Great product.  Wonderful picture.  Easy setup in 15 minutes. This is my second purchase of a Samsung TV in the last couple of years.  They're the best in the business.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: Zhi Xiang
Reviews.Content: I got this on sale for $300, couldn't beat that price. So far the TV has lived up to its expectations. Samsung is known for panel switching but I really haven't noticed any negative defects on my screen. I've watched all sorts of action movies on it and did not notice any adverse motion blur or lag. The TV is very well built and fairly light (one person could carry it). The picture is also very clear, it does take some adjustments with the settings to get the perfect picture but it's not overly complicated.The inputs on this screen is fairly limited tho. It only has 2 HDMI inputs which is not too bad for me as I just use it as an attachment to my PC. The TV also has a USB input for use with the TV's builtin media functions. The TV will natively play any avi, mp4, mkv, etc videos stored on a USB drive. It will also play songs and show pictures on the USB drive. This makes the TV semi-smart and great for living room use as well.Overall, I love the TV, great build quality and great picture. I've got another Samsung 40in LCD TV from 2009 and Samsung has yet to fail me.

Reviews.Title: Great television
Reviews.Author: Anthony Cook
Reviews.Content: This television is amazing.  I love the color and the sharpness of the image.  I'm happy it's 60Hz as well and not 120Hz.  The movie mode enhances the contrast and is perfect for blurays as well as DVDs.

Reviews.Title: Works great. Exactly what I was looking for.
Reviews.Author: Matt Dederick
Reviews.Content: I looked through several product reviews before purchasing this and I am definitely happy with the TV. Even with my first shipment being broken I had another sent to me 2 days later. The TV was everything I expected and I had even found an amazon review that was listed with detailed settings that were perfect.

Reviews.Title: A 39" as they sould be
Reviews.Author: Herbert F. Tipton
Reviews.Content: A good choice based on Consumer Reports rating. hoping to use in RV. You'll be well pleased everything's as it should be.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart Television!
Reviews.Author: Regina
Reviews.Content: After remodeling our basement we bought the Samsung Smart t.v. and were so pleased we bought  a second to replace a large 55".  It is easy to set up and navigate, great picture and the Smart function is convenient and easy to use. We are very pleased with this television!

Reviews.Title: Great for casual use, tech guys may be underwhelmed.
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv if you aren't too keen on the "soap opera effect" you sometimes get when watching things on HD/Bluray resolution.The screen is beautiful, the blacks are rich. The colors are vibrant. A bit light on the backside ports. Just two HDMI ports. Only one set of AV plugs. There might be two USB ports, might just be one.Know the specs you want before you buy! I love it because I got what I wanted at a great price, but this TV isn't top of the line.

Reviews.Title: Worked great after adjustments to picture & setting game mode etc.. for a couple weeks
Reviews.Author: MakeshifT
Reviews.Content: This TV looks great, after fine-tuning. The delivery was fast & undamaged. It looks nice, is slim & light, overall. Some things I have to return it for: Using PC DVI to HDMI in to the port specified, TV began to shut off picture and message stating there was no source, displays. (check source, plug, etc) Had no issues previously, I've been a support agent for software & hardware paired with Windows & Mac, Dial-up & cable, built more than a couple long-running systems. I've had the issue repeat after several hours of use while playing a game, or browsing the web. When it became more frequent, I Tried the HDMI out to HDMI in as it does not suggest doing, which,makes the text look rough.. just requires several adjustments (sharpness, clear-type [windows] , etc) That worked fine for about a week. Then it happened with this connection, with a different surge protector, though both seemed to work fine with everything else plugged in, & the video card is relatively new, well-reviewed, worked fine before this TV/Monitor. This unit / stand, doesn't swivel, though it states otherwise in spec.'s, i swear =]~ Technical Support from Samsung... I will be honest & say it wasn't a good experience, thought the agent sounded nice enough, was polite, etc.. just not experienced in troubleshooting in English for PC's plugged into the product, IMO. Well, Amazon is helping me with the return, so thank you for them, good try, Samsung.. this isn't the first story I know of where your products let someone down, early in their service, even though you charge more than the competitors; often with shorter warranties.. just my first personal experience with it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung tv
Reviews.Author: A. Mckee "eekcma"
Reviews.Content: The TV seams to work fine. I chose Samsung because the TV repair guy I took my old set to said they were good quality and easy to get parts for if they break.  The only reason I didn't give five stars was this set doesn't have many options as far as where you can plug things like cable or dvd players.  The sound and picture are both very good, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: No External Speaker Use through Headphone Audio Jack
Reviews.Author: c_hristy
Reviews.Content: You can plug speakers into the regular audio jack, but it will play sound from those speakers and from the TV and the Volume controls on the TV remote only work for the TV.Usually, anything you plug into a headphone output jack supercedes all other audio sources, and the TV or computer (or ANY electronic device) remote will work.Also, this follows the Samsung trend of the worst on-set power button ideas. This is the fourth Samsung TV/monitor I've owned with a horrid on-set power button.I always buy Samsung, but if I had known about the speaker problem I absolutely would have chosen another brand or product.

Reviews.Title: Love the picture quality
Reviews.Author: Patrick Reed
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a replacement tv for our home.  It is so much better than our old flat screen.

Reviews.Title: Great TV if you don't want a smart TV review of 39-inch tv
Reviews.Author: WB
Reviews.Content: Best value non smart tv on amazon. This review is of the 39 inch model. I did a lot of research and at the time this was by far the highest quality and best value at this price point and size. It's not a smart tv but most smart tv's apps are hard to use and poorly implemented besides I have an xbox and chromecast so I don't care about it being a dum TV.Picture: super bright amazing image quality for the price point this tv will not disappoint! Extremely customizable image settings allow you to adjust the picture just how you want it. A quick google search will yield settings that work well but I had to fiddle with the backlighting and black levels to get it how I thought looked best.Sound: other reviews say sound sucks on this tv. The sound is actually quite good as long as it's not mounted to the wall. When wall mounted or pushed up against the wall the sound sounds tinny like how your cellphone speaker sounds when placed speaker down on a table. When the tv is on a tv stand one foot from the wall it has great, clear very loud sound that is more than adequate for my use. That being said a external subwoofer and/or sound bar would be advisable for anyone who likes a lot of extra "BASS"I love the power button on this tv! It is a small joystick located on bottom right of TV. It gives you easy access to the settings and menus in a easy to use and intuitive design. Compare this to many tv's which you can't access the menu without the remote.

Reviews.Title: Great Monitor for Graphics
Reviews.Author: Earl Strumpell
Reviews.Content: I work in graphic design and find this monitor is almost perfect right out of the box. Very little calibration needed. It's been consistent and reliable for about four months now. Easy on the eyes, too. Radeon HD 7950 video card, x79 moboComes with required dual-dvi cable. Make sure your video card supports it or you're wasting your money on this one.

Reviews.Title: No beating the price.
Reviews.Author: Alan "Alan"
Reviews.Content: I'm using this in my guest room. My number one criterion was that I wasn't going to spend a lot of money for a set that's rarely used.Really nice picture. Thoughtful controls. The best sound I have heard from the newer LCD TVs.

Reviews.Title: Daughter Loves It
Reviews.Author: William Moore "ballrun"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for the daughter's college apartment and she loves it. The only problem was trying to talk to get over the phone and get the stand installed. She finally had a new stand sent from Samsung because they had sent the wrong screws with this one smehow.  The TV was delivered in 2 days, the extra stand took 10 days!  Go figure...

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Chat Virapongse
Reviews.Content: Bought his TV for our condo. Excellent quality. I love the small bezel. The price is also nice. It was easy to set up.

Reviews.Title: Works as described
Reviews.Author: Texas wife, mother and student
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after the X-Box One we bought wouldn't connect to the old TV in the game room- (it was too old). This Samsung TV was a good price, which we needed because this was an unplanned purchase.  The picture is awesome and the X-box connected easily.  My daughter is getting good use out of the X-box now.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a bedroom
Reviews.Author: Russ Fair
Reviews.Content: Wanted a small but viewable TV for the bedroom. This is perfect, great picture, easy hookup. Had to buy a box from HomeGoods to sit it on, so Icould view it better, without hagning on the wall, other than that you won't be disappointed. Even the sound is good

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: Timothy O'mara
Reviews.Content: exactly what I ordered.  I will have to adjust some of the settings but picture is very clear.  It replaces an old Sumsung that blew its' power board and does not work anymore.  We love the picture for Samung and this fit within our budget.  Good buy and now it comes with a USB connection so we can watch movies and see our photo album on a USB flash drive.

Reviews.Title: works fine
Reviews.Author: Carol A. Hadley
Reviews.Content: Works well had no problems setting it up. Easy to set up.  Only had an antenna not cable and it worked fine.

Reviews.Title: Really like it
Reviews.Author: ex-jerseygirl
Reviews.Content: I looked at this unit in a store first since I was uncomfortable buying a TV without seeing it.  The unit came promptly, was easy to setup, has reasonably good sound and a reasonably good picture right out of the box.  (I was upgrading from an ancient TV so it may be that my expectations are a lot lower than some people's, though!)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: thomas m griffin
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV with a wonderful reception. Would recommend to everyone. Price was very low compared to other makes. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: Perfect bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Bear
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my buddy for his bday and he loves it! I finally got to see it installed over the weekend and was very impressed at the picture/build quality for the price of the unit. Clean, simple and sleek look (I own the 60" version of this TV and love mine as well).TV is perfect for small to mid-size bedrooms/office/living rooms, and don't require all the "smart TV and 3D" bells and whistles. Blu Rays looked amazing as did DirecTV. For the price, his TV is great for the referenced applications. Unit has two HDMI inputs so keep that in mind when purchasing. Didn't matter for my friend as all he had in his bedroom was TV and a Blu Ray. Unless you have an amp that has multiple HDMI inputs with a master out you will need a different TV with over three HDMI connections that you would require. Great TV. Period!

Reviews.Title: Good Buy for the Price
Reviews.Author: Claudie F. Bagley "bag12go in phoenix"
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture. Easy to mount on stand and knowing Samsung is first in quality I'll have it for a long time. The remote seems kind of cheep but works well. My only regret is not getting a larger one with wifi and blueTooth. Next time.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Diana and Bob
Reviews.Content: Excellent price, excellent sound and picture.  Wish it had a couple more access hook ups like HDMI, but for the money I can't complain.  Samsung is just a great brand name and this TV lives up to that brand.

Reviews.Title: ajay63
Reviews.Author: Ajay63
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying it love the picture and the sound is great! Will probably purchase another one in the very near future.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for computer monitor!
Reviews.Author: Tam Nguyen
Reviews.Content: This TV is pretty amazing. I really don't have anything negative to say about it. I bought the 32" model a year before to use as my computer monitor. Recently, I sold the 32" model to a friend and bought the 39" one, also to use as a computer monitor. It's gorgeous!One thing to note though: if you use it for you computer, make sure to go to the Menu >> Input > Edit Name >> HDMI >> change it to "PC".

Reviews.Title: I am really happy
Reviews.Author: Raj Trivedi
Reviews.Content: I got this and its really good on sale and it would be the best choice for me to have.

Reviews.Title: Great size and picture
Reviews.Author: J. Raleigh "Constantine"
Reviews.Content: Only issue is that it only has 2 hdmi ports. Very limited on inputs so be careful. Other than that I find the quality great.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound for the $$ - used for movies
Reviews.Author: Xin Kuzi
Reviews.Content: Very nice. Very happy with my purchase.This TV has:-IPS Display!-Direct LED backlighting!-Ability to play movies and mp3s and view pictures through USB!-Other good things!This is the only size in Samsung's FH5000 series that has an IPS display!The picture is beautiful. The blacks are deep, the colors are rich. It works well in a well-lit or dark room. I used the calibration settings that another reviewer posted (it's one of the top reviews). I'd recommend starting with those settings, but I think the picture looked nice out of the box.The sound was surprisingly good. It gets quite loud. The different sound modes on the tv really improve things for different functions (movie, music, voice, etc).This tv has the ability to play movie files via a USB connection. So far, I've tried playing a few files on an old USB flash drive, and it works flawlessly. The menu system is simple but effective. The response times are great, as far as playing of files is concerned. In addition to movies, you can play mp3s and view photos through the same menu. Noise!I've tested it as a pc monitor through HDMI, and so far it's worked very well as one. I tried a couple games on Steam (Killing Floor and Payday) and they both looked great.As an Xbox 360 display, it's just lovely, you guys. The input response and display response times are very low. I can't detect any input lag on 360 games like GTA V and Fight Night 3 or PC FPSs like Killing Floor and Payday.Come ooon!For $377, this is a great price for the size and feature set of this TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: muvywriter
Reviews.Content: This television has among the best-quality and highest-definition screens that I have seen.  Individual hairs can be seen fluttering in the breeze and the colors are fabulous.  It's a great buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound
Reviews.Author: LynneG "Yarn Yearner, Story Seeker, Legend Lo...
Reviews.Content: Bought this to replace an old Samsung LCD.  This one is much lighter in weight than the other.  Picture is crisper and the blacks are much blacker (suspect old LCD backlight was always on, making the black a dark gray).  Sound is good quality.  Works well with all input and output connections.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN39FH5000 39-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED DUMB TV
Reviews.Author: Carl J. Mcgee
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV.  Great price.Terrific picture.  I don't use the TV sound system, Does not have WEB, I don't need that, so no review on that. Slow ground delivery.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Johnny Shoehorn
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV, great quality picture, volume has a great range.  This isn't a Smart TV, so if you want to access the internet or Netflix you need a separate device for that, but the TV itself is excellent and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding !!!!!
Reviews.Author: JonZ
Reviews.Content: Packaging protected HDTV during shipment. Instructions are clear and include helpful videos. Installation of base was easy. Initial set-up, including Apple TV, was easy to follow on-screen. Picture is very good right out of the box. Sound volume is more than enough for my 75 year old ears. Electric cord is long enough to reach outlet. Remote instructions are clear and the remote works well. All of this was determined on the day I received the HDTV. This TV is an outstanding replacement for my prior set, also Samsung, which is now serving us well in the kitchen. I am very happy with this purchase through Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality not what was expected after reading many individual ratings of the TV.
Reviews.Author: C. Zanotti "punky"
Reviews.Content: Picture quality not what was expected after reading many individual ratings of the TV. Annoying loud beeping when turning on and off.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: J. D. Perry
Reviews.Content: We have been very pleased with the television.  It has a good picture and sound quality is adequate for a fairly large room (15x15).  I would definitely recommend this product.  My only critique at present is the sound the television makes when the power goes on and off.  It plays a 4-5 note chime that does not have volume control on it.  As such, I have been unable to find a way to silently turn on and off the TV.

Reviews.Title: Love our new Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: Marla B. Abell
Reviews.Content: Wanted new LED flat screen to replace big old tv and after checking around found this one to be one liked best - picture and clarity.  However sound needs help because of design.  Bought sound bar to attach and works great now  Glad I checked and found this on Amazon - Great price and fast delivery plus fee shipping- can't beat that

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Gary Campla
Reviews.Content: I needed a TV for my grand kids room so they can watch and plays games when they come to visit (I have a lot of grand kids so some are here almost on a daily basis). Being old and on a budget I took a risk and ordered this Samsung 39" TV, I was thinking, how can anybody build a set like this for so little money and be any good. I was pleasantly surprised to find out how easy it was to assemble and set up, it took only minutes with just a screw driver. The picture is nice and clear and it can connect to the internet. The internet part I could have done without, don't expect to surf the net as you do with a computer. Because of the quality of this TV I think it's a great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV. Good price
Reviews.Author: Ron Schrader
Reviews.Content: The picture is excellent, however, the volume seems a bit muffled. Not what I expected as I've been very happy with Samsung TVs and have always felt they've had the best quality.

Reviews.Title: HIGH QUALITY AT A BARGAIN PRICE
Reviews.Author: John Irons
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd Samsung TV and is a joy to operate. Outstanding picture whether signal source is 1080i or 750i. Sound is remarkably good considering the slimness of the cabinetry and the fact that the speakers fire down. Perfect size as its in a cabinet that wouldn't allow a 40 inch, but for a lot less money, the 39 fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Picture
Reviews.Author: Jeana Hurst
Reviews.Content: No complaints; great picture quality, and as expected. Would buy the same item again. Price honored after a list price change.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: Gerald M. Deslauriers "dog lover"
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt Samsung has the best HD televisions on the market as far as picture quality. This TV was no exception. The color is beautiful, picture is bright and detailed. Could not be happier!

Reviews.Title: Been using this awhile and love it
Reviews.Author: truthseeker57
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews in Consumers Report about this TV, and found it to be a great buy (Tenth in its class, I believe). They have recommendations for which settings to use for the best quality picture, which I intended to use, but fidgeted with it enough that I was able to dial in myself which works best. The only thing I would say that is close to a complaint is that I use so many different sources that I find I have to constantly adjust for sound quality, but I can't really blame the TV for that. Actually, for just using the speakers from the TV, I would have to say that the sound quality is AOK in my book. There are different settings for the sound for movies, standard, etc. The menu is also easy to use, although there are a lot of choices, some of which I have been unable to access a couple various pull-down menus, because I haven't finished playing with it enough to find the necessary settings to do that. But, I would say that it is a very easy TV to set up, and adjust. After all, I am not a rocket scientist, but was still able to get the TV set up and working, without having to call in Geek Squad, or some such tech support experts.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Big O
Reviews.Content: This is my first Samsung television and I must say this model has a very good picture especially when watching from a angle. The TV comes on very fast compared to other models Ive owned. This one even has a time function. lightweight and very user friendly. i highly recommend this model.

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Tony Dell
Reviews.Content: This 39" Samsung is a wonderful smaller TV without all the frills.  If this size works for you and you don't need a "smart TV", then this one is a consideration.  The HD works like a charm and as this is a third set for the guest bedroom, we didn't need a option heavy unit.  Good picture and OK sound.  EZ to wall mount.hd

Reviews.Title: Guaranteed Likable
Reviews.Author: Anthony J.
Reviews.Content: I connect my own computer and sound system so I wasn't looking for a feature packed do everything TV. I've yet to see the benefits of 120 Hz, although I own another TV and a computer monitor that provide for it. I know many who are dissatisfied with their smart TV's also. Honestly folks, I just don't need every new gizmo that comes out. Direct TV with DVR, my computer for internet TV and the rest, this works for me.So if you're like me and just want a quality TV with an excellent picture this size and don't want all the add ons, you can quit your shopping right here and now.

Reviews.Title: Sooo gorgeous!
Reviews.Author: Jared Murch
Reviews.Content: My friend and I bought this as a combined Christmas/Birthday gift for her mom. I have to say it again... Soooooo Gorgeous!!! With a handful of adjustments to the picture settings and it just shines. If you're looking for an LED TV around 40"s, this will beat any comparative models by any other brand. It was also rated #1 in the 37-39" LED category of Consumer Reports.... I guess I could have just said that in the beginning.. ^^

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D. Badger
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a inexpensive TV for my master bedroom and this set fit the bill. Was impressed with the picture and the sound was really good. My wife suffers from hearing loss and was concerned that the speakers were in the back. Her Visio set had them in the front, but the sound was so good that she has no issues hearing it. There is a feature in the sound settings that enhances the talking and reduces the background noise. Really nice.

Reviews.Title: Better be handy to assemble
Reviews.Author: Uta "organic gardener"
Reviews.Content: Overall the TV works good and the picture is nice. The only trouble we found was in the assembly. The stand did not match up and had to be taken appart to line it up. Need a few good tools.

Reviews.Title: Am pretty happy with set.
Reviews.Author: History Buff
Reviews.Content: Only problem is audio -- have to keep changing it.  Picture is great -- first time I have a screen over 27 inches.  Remote works fine

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but not sound.
Reviews.Author: Sidahknee
Reviews.Content: Overall I love my TV, but the only problem I have with it is the sound. The sound is not the best for movies and such, so if you are using it for that I would suggest getting surround sound or something to that extent.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great sound quality, easy to install.
Reviews.Author: Eric Dolson
Reviews.Content: Easy 5 star rating - quality of sound rivals that of a high fidelity sound system.  I would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: This is one great TV.
Reviews.Author: JRB Cincinnati "JRB"
Reviews.Content: I debated spending $150 more for the 40" model but decided to try this.  It has Samsung's typical excellent picture and is a great value for the money.  You can't buy a TV this good at the price I got.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful TV
Reviews.Author: Sue E. Kain
Reviews.Content: This replaced my ancient tube type which still worked ok and had a good picture.  I basically unpacked it and hooked it up.  Everything perfect out of the box.  I bought it because my daughter gave me a blu ray player with wi fi for Christmas, but could not hook it up to my old tv.  I love my new stuff.  I never realized I could do all this and it would be so easy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice for bedroom tv
Reviews.Author: Emery Throneberry
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv for the bedroom along with a wall mount. The tv arrived in perfect condition. Plugged it in and it came up with a beautiful picture. Did not have to make any adjustments to get an excellent picture. I have a 60" Sony in the den which is also an excellent tv but I can tell not difference in the quality of the picture. They both are excellent. I would recommend this tv for anyone not wanting a smart tv.

Reviews.Title: Terrific Gift
Reviews.Author: Janice Graves
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for each of my son's this year for Christmas.  The picture is wonderful, and they loved this TV.  Wonderful product.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN39FH5000 39-Inch
Reviews.Author: Francis E Lawrence
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the good folks at Amazon I was able to surprise my 86 year old Uncle Stan. To see the expression of joy on his face was priceless.Thank You!!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty great for watching Netflix
Reviews.Author: Hunter Hadlock
Reviews.Content: Great deal for the price. Really dark blacks, amazing video contrast. The blacks are very, very black. The TV show 'Archer' has a black outline around all of the characters and gives a lot of visual contrast, it really shows off the contrast. I use mine with a Chromecast and power the chromecast using the USB port on the back. If you set the name of one of the inputs to "PC" it will let you use it as a PC monitor without any "tv image post-processing"Dimensions of my unit (as measured by me and my measuring tape) are 35.5x21x3.8" without the stand. Screen (not including bezel) measured by me is 38.5" diagonal, 19x33" vertical/horizonal.The remote has a backlight function - nice! It seems to be compatible with my other, larger Samsung TV remotes from 2010 (this TV bought 2014).This is about the right size TV if you have a small/medium size apartment and only watch TV some of the time. I sit about 10' away (center of screen to eyeballs) from the TV and it's perfect for watching sitcoms, netflix or the occasional movie. If you watch a lot of movies or TV is really important to you you should probably look for something bigger, like a 46" TV. If I watched more than one movie a week I would definitely consider getting a bigger TV, but if you only watch netflix and don't want to be "that guy" who doesn't own a TV, this is a quality set that won't take up too much space but still provides a quality viewing experience when you do turn it on.Also - only uses 47 watts! That's less than a traditional lamp. Screen is very bright, default setting is 12/15, I have it sitting in front of two large windows and it's very bright. Turning it up to 15/15 is even brighter, but at 12/15 it's already brighter than most TVs, 15/15 is kind of obnoxiously bright, especially in a dark room.My roommate declared "you can get a lot more TV for less if you go with a cheaper brand like Vizio" and he's right -- but the colors would have been awful. I've bought three flatscreen displays from Samsung previously and I've always been very impressed with the quality. This was no difference. When we plugged it in and watched some 1080i broadcast TV he retracted his previous statement and said "That's actually some quality glass, I'm impressed"Sound is about average, highs/mids are well represented, nothing to phone home about. Bass is... well it's there but you couldn't start a dance party with it. I have a Samsung HW-E450 soundbar in the mail to fix the audio. It's not *bad* but if you chromecast a youtube music video it's possible to hear bass distortion at medium volume (50/100) sometimes (in particular M82's song 'outro'). For comparison I usually listen to sitcoms at about 18-24/100. Think of the built in speakers as an 'emergency backup' if you watch anything other than sitcoms/adult swim on this thing.Only 2 HDMI ports, which is pretty low rent in 2014. Since everything from TV tuners to video game consoles to even cell phones and tablets (search for "MHL adapter") I already have both HDMI ports in use (#1 for Chromecast, #2 for a 15' HDMI cable to my laptop) so if I ever need a third device I will have to buy a $10 autoswitch... which isn't the end of the world but now I have to deal with a second remote specifically to change my video source.

Reviews.Title: Welcome to 2014!
Reviews.Author: sanntay
Reviews.Content: I finally replaced my huge Toshiba CRT 32" TV, which I've had since I moved into my place 11 years ago.  The Samsung has taken some getting used to, but I'm glad to finally be up to date with technology.
